TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TitleStorageBlobMetadata extends System.Object

MemberSignature.Value: public TitleStorageBlobMetadata (string serviceConfigurationId, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageType storageType, string blobPath, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobType blobType, string xboxUserId);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor([in]string serviceConfigurationId, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageType storageType, [in]string blobPath, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobType blobType, [in]string xboxUserId) runtime managed

Docs.param: The service configuration ID (SCID) of the title
The TitleStorageType to get blob metadata objects for. Valid values are TrustedPlatormStorage, JsonStorage and GlobalStorage.
The full path to to the blob. examples: "gameconfig.json" and "user/settings/playerconfiguration.json".
The TitleStorageBlobType of this object. Valid values are Binary, Json and Config.
The Xbox User ID of the title storage to enumerate. Ignored when dealing with GlobalStorage, so passing nullptr is acceptable in that case. (Optional)
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TitleStorageBlobMetadata class with the minimum arguments.
Docs.remarks: All other properties of this class are optional. To initialize optional properties, use the other constructors. ClientTimestamp.UniversalTime is initialized to 0. Length is initialized to 0. TitleStorageBlobMetadata objects retrieved using TitleStorageService::GetBlobMetadataAsync will have current Length and ETag values.

MemberSignature.Value: public TitleStorageBlobMetadata (string serviceConfigurationId, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageType storageType, string blobPath, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobType blobType, string xboxUserId, string displayName, string eTag);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor([in]string serviceConfigurationId, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageType storageType, [in]string blobPath, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobType blobType, [in]string xboxUserId, [in]string displayName, [in]string eTag) runtime managed

Docs.param: The service configuration ID (SCID) of the title
The TitleStorageType to get blob metadata objects for. Valid values are TrustedPlatormStorage, JsonStorage and GlobalStorage.
The full path to to the blob. examples: "gameconfig.json" and "user/settings/playerconfiguration.json".
The TitleStorageBlobType of this object. Valid values are Binary, Json and Config.
The Xbox User ID of the title storage to enumerate. Ignored when dealing with GlobalStorage, so passing nullptr is acceptable in that case. (Optional)
A display name suitable for displaying to the user. (Optional)
An ETag value to be associated with this instance. It is used for upload, download and delete operations. (Optional)
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TitleStorageBlobMetadata class including support for all optional properties except ClientTimestamp.
Docs.remarks: ClientTimestamp.UniversalTime is initialized to 0. Length is initialized to 0. TitleStorageBlobMetadata objects retrieved using TitleStorageService::GetBlobMetadataAsync will have current Length and ETag values.

MemberSignature.Value: public TitleStorageBlobMetadata (string serviceConfigurationId, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageType storageType, string blobPath, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobType blobType, string xboxUserId, string displayName, string eTag, Windows.Foundation.DateTime clientTimestamp);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor([in]string serviceConfigurationId, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageType storageType, [in]string blobPath, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobType blobType, [in]string xboxUserId, [in]string displayName, [in]string eTag, [in]valuetype Windows.Foundation.DateTime clientTimestamp) runtime managed

Docs.param: The service configuration ID (SCID) of the title
The TitleStorageType to get blob metadata objects for. Valid values are TrustedPlatormStorage, JsonStorage and GlobalStorage.
The full path to to the blob. examples: "gameconfig.json" and "user/settings/playerconfiguration.json".
The TitleStorageBlobType of this object. Valid values are Binary, Json and Config.
The Xbox User ID of the title storage to enumerate. Ignored when dealing with GlobalStorage, so passing nullptr is acceptable in that case. (Optional)
A display name suitable for displaying to the user. (Optional)
An ETag value to be associated with this instance. It is used for upload, download and delete operations. (Optional)
A client provided timestamp value to be associated with this instance.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TitleStorageBlobMetadata class including support for all optional properties.
Docs.remarks: Length is initialized to 0. TitleStorageBlobMetadata objects retrieved using TitleStorageService::GetBlobMetadataAsync will have current Length and ETag values.

Docs.summary: The blob path is a unique string that conforms to a SubPath\file format. For example: "alpha\beta\blob.txt".
The type of storage used by the blob. Possible values are: Binary, Json, and Config.
[optional] The timestamp assigned for the blob by the client.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobMetadata CreateTitleStorageBlobMetadataForSessionStorage (string serviceConfigurationId, string blobPath, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobType blobType, string multiplayerSessionTemplateName, string multiplayerSessionName, string displayName, string eTag);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobMetadata CreateTitleStorageBlobMetadataForSessionStorage([in]string serviceConfigurationId, [in]string blobPath, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Xbox.Services.TitleStorage.TitleStorageBlobType blobType, [in]string multiplayerSessionTemplateName, [in]string multiplayerSessionName, [in]string displayName, [in]string eTag) runtime managed

Attribute.AttributeName: Windows.Foundation.Metadata.Deprecated("Title Storage for sessions has been deprecated. Use universal instead.", Windows.Foundation.Metadata.DeprecationType.Deprecate, 0)

Docs.param: The service configuration ID (SCID) of the title
The full path to to the blob. examples: "gameconfig.json" and "user/settings/playerconfiguration.json"
The TitleStorageBlobType of this object. Valid values are Binary, Json and Config.
The multiplayer session template name associated with this object
The multiplayer session name associated with this object
A display name suitable for displaying to the user. (Optional)
An ETag value to be associated with this instance. It is used for upload, download and delete operations. (Optional)
Docs.summary: Creates metadata for a blob for session storage, including support for all optional properties except ClientTimestamp.
Docs.returns: A new instance of the TitleStorageBlobMetadata class for SessionStorage.
Docs.remarks: ClientTimestamp.UniversalTime is initialized to 0. Length is initialized to 0. TitleStorageBlobMetadata objects retrieved using TitleStorageService::GetBlobMetadataAsync will have current Length and ETag values.

Docs.summary: [optional] The friendly display name to show in app UI.
The ETag for the file used in read and write requests. Etags are used to determine if a file have been updated. Each time the file is changes, a new ETag is applied by the service.
Gets the number of bytes of the blob data.

Attribute.AttributeName: Windows.Foundation.Metadata.Deprecated("Title Storage for sessions has been deprecated. Use universal instead.", Windows.Foundation.Metadata.DeprecationType.Deprecate, 0)

Docs.summary: The multiplayer session name this file belongs to if the StorageType is SessionStorage, otherwise null.

Attribute.AttributeName: Windows.Foundation.Metadata.Deprecated("Title Storage for sessions has been deprecated. Use universal instead.", Windows.Foundation.Metadata.DeprecationType.Deprecate, 0)

Docs.summary: The multiplayer session template name this file belongs to if the StorageType is SessionStorage, otherwise null.
The service configuration ID associated with this blob data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void set([in]valuetype Windows.Foundation.DateTime value) runtime managed

Docs.param: To be added.

Docs.summary: The type of storage that contains the blob.
The Xbox User ID of the player that this file belongs to. This value is null for Global and Session files.
